thread.title: Joo Won confesses his ideal woman, dating history
thread.title_full: Joo Won confesses his ideal woman, dating history

author: amendoza
title: Joo Won confesses his ideal woman, dating history
text:
Joo Won confesses his ideal woman, dating history SHARES: 03:00 PM October 15th, 2015 Recommended The Korea Herald/Asia News Network October 15th, 2015 03:00 PM 
Joo Won, the male lead of recently culminated SBS TV drama “Yong-pal,” appeared in Monday night’s “Healing Camp-500 vs. 1” and discussed his relationship history and philosophy. 
The 28-year-old said he has had bad luck with relationships due to personal difficulties in work-love balance. “I have only really dated twice. When I’m working for a show, I become conflicted. The person I like and the female lead of the show pose a psychological tug-of-war in my head,” Joo Won explained. 
“I like the movie ‘Notebook.’ It’s the kind of authentic melodrama I want to act in. A love where both sides are helplessly infatuated,” the actor said. ADVERTISEMENT 
His ideal woman is one who has “a pretty backline and a pot belly with big heart.” If he falls in love he would commit a hundred percent, “When I fall in love I stay in love. I think true affection comes from never thinking about leaving each other,” he said. 
In this episode of “Healing Camp,” Joo won sang a verse from musical “Don Quixote,” showing off his musical skills.
